name: unconscionably
content:

in a way that is morally unacceptable: They are a bunch of self-interested individuals who have unconscionably abused their power. I find many of the recipes published in this magazine to be unconscionably high in fat.
mainlyUK in a way that is unacceptably great in amount: The film is unconscionably long at 2 hours and 48 minutes. The whole process took an unconscionably long time. See
